## Description {#details}

Recycle small arrays allocated from a <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8e612822d4ba7bb36c9c79582a567108">BumpPtrAllocator</a>.

Arrays are allocated in a small number of fixed sizes. For each supported array size, the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayrecycler">ArrayRecycler</a> keeps a free list of available arrays.

Definition at line 28 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h">ArrayRecycler.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### allocate() {#a218a988783b4829bf810f68bd0645bb3}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class AllocatorType&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>T &#42; llvm::ArrayRecycler&lt; T, Align &gt;::allocate (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayrecycler/capacity">Capacity</a> Cap, AllocatorType &amp; Allocator)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Allocate an array of at least the requested capacity.

Return an existing recycled array, or allocate one from Allocator if none are available for recycling.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h/#l00125">125</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h">ArrayRecycler.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### clear() {#ab9b0fb1cc4d9ce7997a79e3976f6e772}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class AllocatorType&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void llvm::ArrayRecycler&lt; T, Align &gt;::clear (AllocatorType &amp; Allocator)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Release all the tracked allocations to the allocator.

The recycler must be free of any tracked allocations before being deleted.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h/#l00104">104</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h">ArrayRecycler.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### clear() {#aa66a69ed68cdd92d2cd979eb3d407120}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class T, size&#95;t Align = alignof(T)&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void llvm::ArrayRecycler&lt; T, Align &gt;::clear (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8e612822d4ba7bb36c9c79582a567108">BumpPtrAllocator</a> &amp;)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Special case for <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8e612822d4ba7bb36c9c79582a567108">BumpPtrAllocator</a> which has an empty Deallocate() function.

There is no need to traverse the free lists, pulling all the objects into cache.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h/#l00115">115</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h">ArrayRecycler.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### deallocate() {#ad2b1501635f0eb20777e26090382c253}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;class T, size&#95;t Align = alignof(T)&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>void llvm::ArrayRecycler&lt; T, Align &gt;::deallocate (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayrecycler/capacity">Capacity</a> Cap, T &#42; Ptr)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Deallocate an array with the specified <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayrecycler/capacity">Capacity</a>.

Cap must be the same capacity that was given to <a href="#a218a988783b4829bf810f68bd0645bb3">allocate()</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h/#l00137">137</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/arrayrecycler-h">ArrayRecycler.h</a>.
